sentences.en: Airlines should stand or fall on their ability to attract passengers.
sentences.cn: 航空公司的成败应该取决于它们吸引乘客的能力。

sentences.en: Dieppe has plenty to attract cross-Channel visitors.
sentences.cn: 迪耶普有很多浏览胜地，吸引游客横渡英吉利海峡前来观光。

sentences.en: He clicked his tongue to attract their attention.
sentences.cn: 他咂嘴发出啧啧声以吸引他们的注意。

sentences.en: He had unmistakably been waving his flag to attract the referee's attention.
sentences.cn: 他显然一直在挥舞旗子吸引主裁判的注意。

sentences.en: He shouted after them, vainly trying to attract their attention.
sentences.cn: 他在他们的后面高喊，想引起他们的注意，却是徒劳。

sentences.en: I guess it was his eyes that attracted me first.
sentences.cn: 我想是他的眼睛首先迷住了我。

sentences.en: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.cn: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

sentences.en: If you want to attract more customers, try advertising in the local paper.
sentences.cn: 如果你要吸引更多顾客，就试试在当地报纸登广告。

sentences.en: Like poles repel, unlike poles attract.
New snowboarding facilities should attract more people.
sentences.cn: 新建的滑雪板运动设施应该会吸引更多的人。

sentences.en: Television programmes are essentially bait to attract an audience for advertisements.
sentences.cn: 从根本上说，电视节目就是吸引观众看广告的诱饵。

sentences.en: The bright plumage of many male birds has evolved to attract females.
sentences.cn: 很多雄鸟进化出鲜艳的羽毛是为了吸引雌鸟。

sentences.en: The new store is better situated to attract customers.
sentences.cn: 新店所处的位置优越，更能吸引客源。

sentences.en: The race organizers are trying to attract sponsors.
sentences.cn: 比赛的组织者在想方设法吸引赞助者。

sentences.en: The salt marshes and mud flats attract large numbers of waterfowl.
sentences.cn: 盐碱地和泥滩吸引了大量水鸟。

sentences.en: There is now intense competition between schools to attract students.
sentences.cn: 现在学校之间为了招揽生源展开了激烈竞争。

sentences.en: We had to hype the film to attract the financiers.
sentences.cn: 我们不得不热炒这部电影以吸引投资人。

sentences.en: What attracted me most to the job was the chance to travel.
sentences.cn: 这份工作最吸引我的地方是有机会旅行。

吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

trans.tran_en: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something
